p: As shown in Figure 3, the positive control minocycline showed the strongest NO inhibition activity with IC 50 = 0.37 μg/mL, which is significantly lower than SG oil ( p < 0.05), SO oil ( p < 0.01), and SP oil ( p < 0.01). Among the three essential oils, SG oil showed the lowest IC 50 of 0.97 μg/mL, which is significantly lower ( p < 0.01) than SO oil (IC 50 = 2.83 μg/mL) and SP oil (IC 50 = 13.48 μg/mL). Even though the SG oil showed weaker NO inhibition activity than minocycline, it still has the strongest NO inhibition effect of any crude essential oil as far as we know.
